hero.heading: Turn Routes Already in Motion into Faster, Cheaper Deliveries
hero.description: GoLynk orchestrates your shipments across couriers, fleets, and crowd capacity — giving you same‑day speed, lower costs, and transparent CO₂ impact.

hiddenCost.heading: The Hidden Cost of Fragmented Logistics
hiddenCost.opening: More demand, more vehicles, more emissions. Each layer of traditional logistics adds cost without coordination.

emptyMiles.title: Empty Miles Run Silent
emptyMiles.text: Trucks run back empty. Couriers crisscross the same zones. No one captures the waste — it's just accepted.

fragmented.title: Fragmented = Duplicated
fragmented.text: Parcel carriers, freight fleets, same‑day couriers — all moving in parallel, rarely sharing a route.

visibility.title: No Visibility, No Leverage
visibility.text: Without seeing routes in motion, there's no way to match new demand to existing capacity.

hiddenCost.closing: GoLynk connects what's already moving to what you need shipped.

whatIs.heading: What Is GoLynk?

crowdshipping.title: Not just crowdshipping
crowdshipping.text: We don't rely only on spontaneous trips.

whatIs.definition: GoLynk is an orchestration layer — routing your shipments across couriers, fleets, crowd, and combined hops based on real‑time capacity, speed priorities, and CO₂ trade‑offs.

howItWorks.heading: How GoLynk Works
howItWorks.description: GoLynk doesn't just dispatch. It orchestrates.

define.title: Step 1: Define Your Flow
define.text: Submit shipment details: origin, destination, timing, volume, constraints. One‑off or recurring — both are supported.

orchestrate.title: Step 2: Orchestrate the Route
orchestrate.text: GoLynk's engine scores all available capacity and combines legs—couriers, fleets, crowd, relays—into the best path based on your priorities.

execute.title: Step 3: Execute and Track
execute.text: Your shipment enters a live orchestration. Track each leg, receive handoff alerts, and see CO₂ data as the route completes.

routeScoring.title: Transparent Scoring
routeScoring.description: See why routes were chosen — with lane metrics and CO₂ comparisons.

twoScales.heading: Same Logic at Two Scales
twoScales.description: Whether your challenge is urban parcels or overland freight, GoLynk applies the same orchestration logic: match demand to routes already in motion.

urban.label: Urban & Regional
urban.heading: Same‑Day Urban & Regional
urban.tagline: Parcels on routes that already exist.
urban.text1: Most same‑day deliveries fail because couriers and fleets run in parallel without visibility. GoLynk matches your order to the nearest feasible leg — whether it's a crowd driver completing a commute, a courier consolidating nearby stops, or a micro‑hub relay.
urban.text2: The result: faster windows and shared capacity, not more vehicles.
features: Crowd + courier + fleet in one engine
On‑route injection for faster delivery windows
urban.closing: Same‑day is achievable when orchestration replaces dispatch.

freight.label: Freight & Long‑Haul
freight.heading: LTL, Lane Freight & Backhauls
freight.text1: You're not always looking for new trucks. Sometimes you need the truck that's already going your way. GoLynk exposes empty legs, underused pallets, and return journeys from logistics operators, letting you fill rather than request.
freight.text2: The result: lower cost, shorter lead time, smarter lane density.
features: Fill empty space on existing runs
Backhaul matching across your own and third‑party fleets
Per‑lane CO₂ benchmarks and improvement tracking
freight.closing: Freight efficiency starts with what's already moving.

adapts.subtitle2: GoLynk matches your flow to routes already in motion.

interfaceDetails.heading: Deep Dive into the Interface
interfaceDetails.description: Explore the key components that make GoLynk's orchestration interface unique.

dashboard.title: Unified Control Dashboard
dashboard.text1: The Unified Control Dashboard provides complete visibility into your logistics operations. Monitor shipments in real-time, track performance metrics, and access detailed analytics—all from a single interface.
dashboard.feature1: • Real-time shipment tracking with multi-hop visibility
dashboard.feature2: • Cost breakdown per leg and total journey
dashboard.feature3: • SLA compliance monitoring with proactive alerts
dashboard.feature4: • CO₂ emissions tracking for sustainability reporting
dashboard.text2: Unlike traditional dispatch systems, the dashboard reflects orchestration intelligence—automatically surfacing exceptions, optimizations, and actionable insights.

api.title: API-First Integration
api.text1: GoLynk's API-first architecture means you don't need to replace your existing systems. Our RESTful APIs and webhooks integrate seamlessly with TMS, WMS, ERP, and e-commerce platforms.
api.feature1: • Order ingestion: Push shipments directly from your systems
api.feature2: • Event streaming: Real-time updates via webhooks
api.feature3: • Capacity exposure: Carriers publish availability programmatically
api.feature4: • Data sync: Cost and emissions data flow back automatically
api.text2: Full API documentation, sandbox environments, and dedicated integration support ensure a smooth implementation process.

trust.title: Trust & Accountability Layer
trust.text1: Every shipment moves through a verified, rule-based environment. GoLynk embeds accountability into the system architecture—not as an afterthought, but as a core principle.
trust.feature1: • Vetted capacity network: All partners screened for compliance
trust.feature3: • Insurance integration: Coverage verified at route eligibility
trust.text2: Reliability isn't dependent on manual coordination—it's built into how GoLynk operates.

items.question: What kinds of shipments does GoLynk support for shippers?
items.answer: GoLynk supports everything from single parcels and e‑commerce orders to pallets, LTL, and full truckloads. You can start with last‑mile parcels and later plug in your B2B flows, regular lanes, and backhauls on the same orchestration layer.

items.question: Do I need to replace my current carriers or freight partners?
items.answer: No. GoLynk is an orchestration layer on top of your existing carriers and lanes. You can keep trusted partners, expose their spare capacity into GoLynk, and let the engine decide when to use your own network, GoLynk's crowd and fleet capacity, or a mix of both.

items.question: How does GoLynk keep my shipments safe and compliant?
items.answer: Shipments are matched to vetted carriers and routes based on handling needs, value, and any sector‑specific requirements. For sensitive flows—like fresh, fragile, or healthcare—GoLynk uses specialist carriers, shorter hops, and clear event trails to support insurance and compliance.

items.question: How do pricing and costs work for shippers?
items.answer: Pricing reflects how well a shipment fits existing routes and capacity, rather than fixed, one‑size‑fits‑all rates. That means you can unlock lower costs when GoLynk fills empty space, backhauls, and returning journeys—without sacrificing service levels.

items.question: How do we integrate GoLynk with our systems?
items.answer: You can start via dashboards and then move to API integration with your TMS, WMS, e‑commerce platform, or ERP. Orders, events, and CO₂ data can flow automatically, so your teams don't need to maintain a separate tool just to use GoLynk.

items.question: How do you calculate CO₂ impact for our shipments?
items.answer: For each shipment, GoLynk estimates emissions using conservative baseline factors and compares them against what a typical courier or truck move would have emitted. The result is per‑shipment and per‑lane avoided‑emissions data you can export into ESG and sustainability reporting.
